required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy of Duodenal Prostheses Not Covered Over 6 Years
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy of Duodenal Prostheses Not Covered Over 6 Years

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the efficacy of duodenal prostheses for duodenal stenosis established for endoscopic pyloric or duodenal stenosis on dysphagia

detailed_description.textblock: Duodenal prostheses have become, since the 2000s, the first-line treatment of unresectable duodenal tumoral stenosis. The technical success is greater than 90%, however the endoscopic revisions that are duodenal or biliary are frequent. The IPC as a center of interventional endoscopy is very often in charge of these stenoses. We wanted to evaluate the efficiency and the duration of this effectiveness in current situation. Is there still room for gastrojejunal gastrojejunal surgery or for the development of endoscopic gastrojejunal anastomoses?

primary_outcome.description: GOOSS = Gastric Outlet Obstruction Scoring System

secondary_outcome.description: defined as the time between the date of duodenal prosthesis insertion and the date of death or the latest news

secondary_outcome.measure: Permeability duration of the duodenal stent
secondary_outcome.description: defined as the time between the date of the laying of the duodenal stent and date of patient's death or RED or surgery (exceptional case) or latest news

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of duodenal endoscopic resection at 1 and 3 months postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of duodenal endoscopic resection at 1 and 3 months postoperatively

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of biliary endoscopic resection at 1 and 3 months postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of biliary endoscopic resection at 1 and 3 months postoperatively

clinical_study.condition: Digestive or Non-digestive Neoplasia Leading to Symptomatic Duodenal Stenosis

arm_group.description: Any symptomatic duodenal stenosis with symptomatic duodenal duodenal prosthesis between 2010 and 2017.

intervention.description: Implantation of an uncovered metal duodenal prosthesis for symptomatic tumor stenosis

study_pop.textblock: Any symptomatic duodenal stenosis with symptomatic duodenal duodenal prosthesis between 2010 and 2017.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any symptomatic duodenal stenosis with symptomatic duodenal duodenal prosthesis between 2010 and 2017.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Benign stenosis or covered metallic duodenal prosthesis (usually indicated for benign disease)

reference.citation: Fiori E, Lamazza A, Volpino P, Burza A, Paparelli C, Cavallaro G, Schillaci A, Cangemi V. Palliative management of malignant antro-pyloric strictures. Gastroenterostomy vs. endoscopic stenting. A randomized prospective trial. Anticancer Res. 2004 Jan-Feb;24(1):269-71.

Johnsson E, Thune A, Liedman B. Palliation of malignant gastroduodenal obstruction with open surgical bypass or endoscopic stenting: clinical outcome and health economic evaluation. World J Surg. 2004 Aug;28(8):812-7. Epub 2004 Aug 3.

Jeurnink SM, Steyerberg EW, Hof Gv, van Eijck CH, Kuipers EJ, Siersema PD. Gastrojejunostomy versus stent placement in patients with malignant gastric outlet obstruction: a comparison in 95 patients. J Surg Oncol. 2007 Oct 1;96(5):389-96.
